body: According to http://wiki.vg/Protocol#Open_Window , the number of slots in the packet should exclude the player inventory.

comment_data.body:
Nice.

How do we know this works? As far as my understanding goes we don't even support the latest protocol yet.

@andrewrk Can we get a 1.7 Milestone set up, with this PR and https://github.com/andrewrk/mineflayer/pull/173 added to it ? 

Perhaps a 1.7 branch also, keeping changes out of master for 1.6 support. Other option is obviously to branch/tag 1.6
@nevercast I added you to the collaborators list for this project. As far as I'm concerned you can implement either one of the plans you've outlined above - have at it.
I wonder if this PR is still relevant. @rom1504 do chests work currently ?

I don't know, I haven't tested chest.js yet ;)
So I guess we'll know if that PR is still relevant once we know if it works or not yeah.

Ok, chest seems to be working (without this PR).
So I'm not sure how to test this. Maybe it would break if the chest is full and the bot try to add one more item ?

edit: no that works too...

> Ok, chest seems to be working (without this PR).

examples/chest.js still doesn't work for me. I'm trying to debug it, and I'm stuck trying to get a 0x2d Open Window response from the server. Were you able to get some other code working with chests that I can look at?
@thejoshwolfe I just tried examples/chest.js saying "chest" and all, and it just worked. Are you trying it on a vanilla server ?

> Are you trying it on a vanilla server ?

yes. when i say "chest", the bot looks at the chest and swings his arm, but i don't see the chest opening animation, and the bot waits forever expecting the window open message.

 * mineflayer from source: 0d109a55b68cb92cf6a009213bdd982ede7f2061
 * node-minecraft-protocol from source: a7dd89953d855ceaaf5cd017103e9a15aeb86661 (and I ran `npm install` which ran gulp after I updated)
 * minecraft client: 1.8.3
 * minecraft server: 1.8.3

> mineflayer from source: 0d109a5

just updated to f4e8051a0698fcc6ada803cca53185665bd06852, and get the same thing

That's weird, I just tried one more time, and it works. Are you using a regular chest ? How far do you put the block from the chest ?
Is there many things in the chest ?
I'm trying that with the "Open to lan" mode of the vanilla client, is it any different to the vanilla server ?

> How far do you put the block from the chest ?

What block? Am I using this bot wrong? I just placed a chest next to him (2 blocks away) and said "chest". I thought he was supposed to list the contents of the chest.

> I'm trying that with the "Open to lan" mode of the vanilla client, is it any different to the vanilla server ?

Oh my goodness. that's it. It works for me in "Open to LAN" mode as well. So the dedicated server is different then.

Really oO ...
Yeah I meant "How far do you put the bot from the chest ?"

So I guess I'll have to try with an actual minecraft server...

In Open to LAN did you also try in creative mode ? Does it have anything to do with creative mode or is there really a difference between the minecraft server and the open to lan mode ?

Edit: Ok I tried it with open to lan + survivor, the chest still works. So there's really a difference between the minecraft server and the open to lan mode

So, since chest still works on minecraft_server without this PR, what to do of it ?

I'm not sure the recipe change is correct, it's about redstone wire vs redstone block ( http://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Block_of_Redstone )

milestone.description:
Minecraft 1.8.x compliant bot
All examples should work and code thoroughly checked

title: Fix chest slot size conditions.
